ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
eligibility: OBC students studying post-matriculation courses (Class 11 onwards) in India
benefits: Maintenance allowance and tuition reimbursement based on eligibility criteria.
application_process: Apply via NSP or state-specific portals, subject to notification.

Scheme Title: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
Description: A fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC) to support single girl children pursuing Ph.D. research in various disciplines.

Eligibility.Target Group: Single girl child (only girl child in the family or one of twin daughters)
Eligibility.Education: Registered in a regular, full-time Ph.D. program in a recognized university/college/institute
Exclusions: Families with one or more sons and one daughter
Ph.D. courses pursued in part-time/distance mode

Benefits.Tenure: 5 years or until submission of Ph.D. thesis, whichever is earlier

Fellowship.JRF: ₹ 31,000 per month for initial two years

Humanities & Social Sciences: ₹ 10,000 per year for initial two years
Science, Engineering & Technology: ₹ 12,000 per year for initial two years

Financial Assistance.HRA: As per Govt. of India norms

Leave.Maternity/Paternity Leave: As per Govt. of India norms

Department / Ministry: University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education

Target Beneficiaries.Caste: SC/ST/OBC/PWD candidates receive relaxed eligibility criteria

Scheme Title: Coaching Schemes For SC/ST/OBC (Non-Creamy Layer) & Minority Students For Universities
Description: A coaching scheme aimed at providing equal opportunities and academic support to students from SC, ST, OBC (non-creamy layer), and minority communities to help them pursue higher education and competitive exams.

Institutions Eligible: Universities and colleges under Section 2(f) and 12(B) of the UGC Act, 1956
Institutions with a sufficient number of SC/ST/OBC/Minority students

Remedial Coaching: Improves academic skills and linguistic proficiency
Strengthens knowledge and comprehension of subjects
Provides career guidance and psychological counseling
Coaching for Entry into Services: Prepares students for employment in Group A, B, and C services
Orients students for exams like IAS, State Public Services, Bank recruitment
Coaching for NET/SET: Prepares SC/ST/OBC/Minority candidates for NET/SET exams
Enhances selection opportunities for university lecturer positions

Non-Recurring Items: One-time grant up to ₹ 5.0 lakhs per scheme
Books, journals, audio-visual aids, computers, printers, photocopiers, generators
Recurring Items: ₹ 7.0 lakhs per university per scheme per annum
Honorarium for coordinators, remuneration for teachers and scholars

Department / Ministry: University Grants Commission (UGC), Ministry of Minority Affairs

Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students enrolled in universities and colleges

Scheme Title: Scholarships to Students with Disabilities Scheme
Description: A state-sponsored scholarship scheme by the Department of Social Security and Women & Child Development, Government of Punjab, aimed at supporting students with disabilities in their education and training.

Eligibility.Disability Requirement: 40% and above disability (as per RPwD Act 2016)
Eligibility.Income Limit: Monthly family/guardian income should not exceed ₹5,000
Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Minimum 40% marks in the previous annual examination

Benefits.Payment Mode: Scholarship credited online to the student's bank account

Department / Ministry: Department of Social Security and Women & Child Development, Government of Punjab

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Families with income below ₹5,000 per month
Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students enrolled in schools from Class 1 onwards

Scheme Title: Award of Opportunity Cost to Parents of Scheduled Caste Girl Students
Description: A financial assistance scheme by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry, aimed at supporting Scheduled Caste parents in sending their daughters to school instead of engaging in labor.

Eligibility.Education Level: Class VI to XII in Government or Government-recognized institutions
Eligibility.Nativity Requirement: Native of Puducherry by birth or continuous residence for at least 3 years
Eligibility.Income Limit: Annual parental income should not exceed ₹24,000
Eligibility.Promotion Requirement: Opportunity cost is payable only if the girl student is promoted to the next higher class

Benefits.Additional Support: Opportunity cost is provided in addition to the Pre-Matric Scholarship

Steps: Login and fill out the application form

Department / Ministry: Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry

Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students enrolled in Class VI to XII

Scheme Title: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DoEPwDs) to support students with disabilities studying in Class 9th and 10th in government or recognized schools.

Eligibility.Disability Requirement: 40% or above disability (as per RPwD Act 2016)
Eligibility.Income Limit: Total annual income of parents/guardians must not exceed ₹2.00 Lakh
Other Conditions: Applicant must not be availing any other government scholarship
Applicant must not be the third sibling receiving this scholarship

Exclusions: Scholarship will not be given to more than two students from a family (except in case of twins)
Scholarship holders cannot receive any other stipend
False information/document submission leads to recovery with 15% compound interest and blacklisting
Students repeating a class will not receive the scholarship for that class again

Steps: Register on the National Scholarship Portal

Department / Ministry: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DoEPwDs), Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Families with income below ₹2.00 Lakh per annum

Scheme Title: Ishan Uday Special Scholarship Scheme For North Eastern Region
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education and the University Grants Commission (UGC) to promote higher education in the North Eastern Region (NER) by providing financial assistance to economically weaker students.

Eligibility.Domicile Requirement: Applicant must be a domicile of NER
Eligibility.Income Limit: Parental annual income should not exceed ₹4,50,000
Eligibility.Education Requirement: Passed Class 12th or equivalent in the preceding year
Eligibility.Admission Requirement: Secured admission in the first year of a degree course in recognized institutions
Eligible Institutions: Universities/Institutions/Colleges under Section 2(f) and 12(B) of UGC Act
Deemed Universities under Section 3 of UGC Act, 1956
Institutions recognized by other statutory councils

Benefits.Payment Mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary’s bank account

Conditions: Scholarship renewed annually based on good conduct and attendance
Students failing to get promoted to the next class will forfeit the scholarship
Change in course of study leads to forfeiture of scholarship

Exclusions: Students pursuing courses through Open Universities
Students already availing scholarships under other schemes
Students admitted through management quota
Students pursuing diploma courses that do not lead to a degree
Students whose parental income exceeds ₹4,50,000
Department / Ministry: Ministry of Education, University Grants Commission (UGC)

Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students pursuing general, technical, medical, and professional courses

Description: A scholarship scheme by the School Education Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aimed at supporting students from economically weaker backgrounds studying in government schools.

Eligibility.Income Limit: Annual family income should not exceed ₹1,00,000
Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Student must have passed the previous class

Benefits.Payment Mode: Direct transfer to the student's bank account

Steps: Eligible students should contact the Principal of their respective government schools
School teachers enter student profiles on the education portal

Department / Ministry: School Education Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh

Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students enrolled in government schools from Class 6 to 8

Scheme Title: Merit-cum-Means Scholarships For Undergraduate Studies In Various Branches Of Agriculture And Animal Science Subjects
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE), aimed at attracting meritorious students to pursue undergraduate studies in Agriculture, Agricultural Engineering, Home Science, Dairy, and Animal Husbandry.

Eligibility.Residency Requirement: Applicant must be domiciled in India
Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Minimum 60% marks or equivalent grade points in the qualifying examination
Eligibility.Means Test: Parental annual income should not exceed ₹1,00,000
Eligibility.Preferred Candidates: Higher marks in science subjects considered in case of a tie

Benefits.Duration: Tenable for the full duration of the degree course
Benefits.Additional Recognition: Students exceeding the income limit may receive a national prize of ₹500 and a certificate of merit

Steps: Visit the University/College during office hours
Fill in all mandatory fields and attach required documents
Submit the completed application form to the concerned authority
Request a receipt or acknowledgment upon submission

Department / Ministry: Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE)

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Students from families with annual income below ₹1,00,000
Target Beneficiaries.Education: Undergraduate students in Agriculture and Animal Science subjects

Scheme Title: Scheme For Award Of Financial Assistance For Education To The Wards Of Beedi/Cine/IOMC/LSDM Workers – Pre & Post-Matric
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Ministry of Labour and Employment, providing financial assistance for education to the wards of Beedi, Iron Ore Mines, Manganese Ore & Chrome Ore Mines (IOMC), Limestone Mines, Dolomite Mines (LSDM), Mica Mines, and Cine Workers.

Eligibility.Education Requirement: Regular admission in recognized institutions for general or technical education, including medical, engineering, and agricultural studies

Mine Workers: Manual, unskilled, highly skilled, and clerical workers eligible regardless of wages
Supervisory and managerial employees eligible if wages do not exceed ₹10,000 per month
Cine Workers: ₹1,00,000 if paid in lump sum or installments

Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Passed last qualifying examination on the first attempt or promoted to the next class
Eligibility.Parental Employment: At least one parent must be a Beedi, IOMC, LSDM, or Cine worker with at least six months of service
Eligibility.Bank Account Requirement: Scholar must have a separate bank account

Exclusions: Scholarship obtained through false statements
Discontinuation of studies
Change in course or institution without approval
Unsatisfactory academic progress or misconduct
Parent ceasing to be a Beedi/Mine/Cine worker
Students pursuing studies through correspondence
Students receiving scholarships from other sources
Department / Ministry: Directorate of Social Welfare, Ministry of Labour and Employment

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Wards of Beedi, IOMC, LSDM, and Cine workers

Scheme Title: Free Education For Sports Medal Winners / Participants Of National/ International Events
Description: A scholarship scheme by the University Grants Commission, Ministry of Education, aimed at supporting medal-winning sportspersons pursuing higher education and motivating them to excel in both sports and academics.

Eligibility.Target Group: Medal winners of National Games and participants in recognized international sporting events
Eligible Institutions: Universities/Institutions/Colleges under sections 2(f) and 12(b) of the UGC Act, 1956
Deemed Universities under section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956
Eligibility.Renewal Criteria: Scholarship renewal depends on continued sports performance

Benefits.Tuition Fee Coverage: Actual tuition fees for eligible courses
Benefits.Hostel Facilities: Actual boarding and lodging expenses covered
Benefits.Special Courses Abroad: Allowances as per Government of India norms

Exclusions: Misconduct reported by the institution
Unsatisfactory academic progress
Change in course or institution without approval
Scholarship termination upon recommendation by the university
Department / Ministry: University Grants Commission (UGC), Ministry of Education

Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students pursuing higher education in recognized institutions

Scheme Title: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana: Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme
Description: A scheme by the Ministry of Education, Government of India, providing full interest subsidy during the moratorium period on education loans for students from economically weaker sections.

Eligibility.Income Limit: Parental annual income up to ₹4.5 lakhs
Eligibility.Education Loan Requirement: Loans taken under the IBA Model Education Loan Scheme
Eligibility.Course Requirement: Professional/technical courses from NAAC accredited institutions, NBA accredited programs, Institutions of National Importance, or Centrally Funded Technical Institutions (CFTIs)
Eligibility.Admissibility: Applicable only once for Undergraduate or Postgraduate degree courses, including Integrated Courses
Exclusions: Students availing other Central/State Government scholarships or fee reimbursements
Students discontinuing courses midstream (except for medical reasons)
Students expelled on disciplinary or academic grounds

Benefits.Interest Subsidy: Provided for a maximum loan amount of ₹10 lakhs
Benefits.Collateral Requirement: No collateral security or third-party guarantee required for loans up to ₹7.5 lakhs
Benefits.Interest Concession: Banks may provide a 1% interest concession if interest is serviced during the study period and moratorium period

Department / Ministry: Ministry of Education, Government of India

Scheme Title: CBSE Merit Scholarship Scheme For Single Girl Child
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education for meritorious single girl students who are the only child of their parents and have passed the CBSE Class 10th Examination with 60% or more marks.

Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Passed CBSE Class 10th with 60% or more marks
Eligibility.Education Level: Studying in Class 11th & 12th in CBSE-affiliated schools
Eligibility.Tuition Fee Limit: Not more than ₹1,500 per month (10% enhancement allowed over two years)
Eligibility.Additional Eligibility: NRI applicants eligible with a tuition fee limit of ₹6,000 per month

Department / Ministry: Ministry of Education, Government of India

Scheme Title: Prime Minister’s Special Scholarship Scheme For The Students Of Union Territories Of Jammu & Kashmir And Ladakh
Description: A scholarship scheme by AICTE for students domiciled in J&K and Ladakh, providing financial assistance for higher education outside these UTs.

Eligibility.Domicile Requirement: Applicant must be a domicile of J&K or Ladakh
Eligibility.Education Requirement: Passed Class 12th from JKBOSE or CBSE-affiliated schools in J&K or Ladakh
Eligibility.Income Limit: Family income should not exceed ₹8,00,000 per annum
Eligibility.Lateral Entry: Diploma holders from recognized Polytechnic Institutes in J&K and Ladakh
Eligibility.Application Requirement: Compulsory online registration on AICTE portal

Benefits.Payment Mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) using PFMS gateway

Exclusions: Students pursuing courses through Open Universities
Students availing benefits from other scholarship schemes
Students admitted through Management Quota
Students pursuing Diploma or Postgraduate courses
Students with family income exceeding ₹8,00,000 per annum
Students not applying through AICTE portal
Students admitted to non-prescribed colleges
Department / Ministry: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of Education

Target Beneficiaries.Region: Union Territories of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh
Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Students from families with income below ₹8,00,000
Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students pursuing higher education outside J&K and Ladakh

Description: A financial support scheme by the Ministry of Education, Government of India, providing collateral-free, guarantor-free education loans with interest subvention for meritorious students pursuing higher education.

Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Merit-based admission to one of the 860 designated Quality Higher Educational Institutions (QHEIs)
Eligibility.Income Limit: Annual family income up to ₹8,00,000 for 3% interest subvention
Exclusions: Students admitted through management quota
Students receiving other Central/State Government scholarships or fee reimbursements
Students discontinuing courses midstream or expelled on disciplinary/academic grounds

Loan Features: Loan amount covers tuition fees, hostel fees, living expenses, and other associated costs
No upper limit on loan amount
Interest Subvention: 3% interest subvention on loans up to ₹10,00,000 for students with annual family income up to ₹8,00,000
Full interest subvention for students with annual family income up to ₹4,50,000 under PM-USP CSIS
Benefits.Credit Guarantee: 75% credit guarantee by the Government of India for loan amounts up to ₹7,50,000
Benefits.Repayment Period: Up to 15 years, excluding moratorium period
Benefits.Additional Interest Concession: Up to 1% if interest is serviced during study and moratorium period
Benefits.Payment Mode: Interest subvention credited to e-voucher/Programmable Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) wallet

Department / Ministry: Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Education, Government of India

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Students from families with income below ₹8,00,000

Scheme Title: National Scheme Of Incentive To Girls For Secondary Education
Description: A scheme by the Ministry of Education aimed at promoting the enrollment and retention of girl students from Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities in secondary education.

Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Passed Class 8th from Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas
Eligibility.Enrollment Requirement: Enrolled in Class 9th in State/UT Government, Government-aided, or local body schools from the academic year 2008-09 onwards

Benefits.Financial Assistance: ₹3,000 deposited in a fixed deposit in a public sector bank or post office
Benefits.Withdrawal Conditions: No premature withdrawal allowed; funds accessible upon reaching 18 years of age

Exclusions: Married girls
Students studying in private unaided schools
Students enrolled in Central Government-run schools

Steps: Register and obtain an Application ID
Login and complete the application form

Department / Ministry: Ministry of Education, Government of India

Scheme Title: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan (PM-USP) Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship for College and University Students
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Education, providing financial assistance to meritorious students from economically weaker families for higher studies.

Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Above the 80th percentile of successful candidates in Class 12th Board Examination
Eligibility.Education Level: Pursuing regular degree courses in recognized institutions
Eligibility.Income Limit: Parental/family income should not exceed ₹4,50,000 per annum
Eligibility.Attendance Requirement: At least 75% attendance for scholarship renewal
Exclusions: Students pursuing correspondence or distance mode courses
Students availing benefits from other scholarship schemes

Scholarship Amount.Graduation Level: ₹12,000 per annum for the first three years
Scholarship Amount.Professional Courses (5-year duration): ₹20,000 per annum for the 4th and 5th year
Scholarship Amount.Technical Courses (B.Tech, B.Engg.): ₹12,000 per annum for the first three years, ₹20,000 in the 4th year

Benefits.Disbursal Mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary’s bank account

Steps: Register and obtain an Application ID
Login and complete the application form

Department / Ministry: Department of Higher Education, Ministry of Education

Target Beneficiaries.Economic Status: Students from families with income below ₹4,50,000
Target Beneficiaries.Education: Students pursuing graduate, postgraduate, and professional courses

Scheme Title: Pragati Scholarship Scheme For Girl Students (Technical Diploma)
Description: A scholarship scheme by AICTE, Ministry of Education, aimed at supporting girl students pursuing technical diploma courses in AICTE-approved institutions.

Eligibility.Education Level: First-year or second-year (through lateral entry) of a technical diploma course
Eligibility.Income Limit: Annual family income should not exceed ₹8,00,000
Eligible Regions: Dadra and Nagar Haveli & Daman and Diu

Benefits.Financial Assistance: ₹50,000 per annum for up to 3 years (for first-year students) or 2 years (for lateral entry students)
Benefits.Usage: Covers college fees, purchase of computer, stationeries, books, equipment, software
Benefits.Exclusions: No additional grant for hostel charges, medical expenses

Exclusions: Students who fail or drop out in subsequent years
Students receiving financial assistance from other sources
Students with a gap of more than two years between passing the qualifying exam and admission
Scholarship applicable to a maximum of two girl children per family
Department / Ministry: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of Education

Target Beneficiaries.State: Open to candidates from specified regions

Scheme Title: AICTE – Saksham Scholarship Scheme For Specially-Abled Student (Degree)
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education, implemented by AICTE, aimed at supporting specially-abled students in pursuing technical education.

Eligibility.Education Level: First-year or second-year (through lateral entry) of a degree-level course in AICTE-approved institutions
Eligibility.Income Limit: Annual family income should not exceed ₹8,00,000
Eligibility.Required Documents: Valid income certificate issued by State/UT Government

Benefits.Financial Assistance: ₹50,000 per annum for up to 4 years (for first-year students) or 3 years (for lateral entry students)
Benefits.Usage: Covers college fees, purchase of computer, stationeries, books, equipment, software
Benefits.Payment Mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) on an annual basis
Benefits.Renewal Conditions: Scholarship renewal requires submission of passing certificate/mark sheet and letter from the Head of Institution

Exclusions: Students failing to get promoted to the next class
Students with a gap of more than two years between passing the qualifying exam and admission
Students receiving financial assistance from other sources
Students who drop out in subsequent years
Department / Ministry: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of Education
